defs: = ಚೌಕಂಡ.
= ಚೌಘಡೆ.
a region, jurisdiction consisting of four villages.
a playing together of different musical instruments as blow-pipes of different types, drum, etc., at regular intervals ever day (in a temple, palace, etc.).
a kind of musical instrument, used by folk singers.
the perennial vine Sachium edule of Cucurbitaceae family, grown for its edible, fleshy, pear-shaped single-seeded fruit; chayote.
its fruit used as a vegetable; chow-chow.
a mixture of different kinds of things, subjects, etc.
spiced pasta in the form of long, very thin strings, fried in oil; a crisp light dish.
of or relating to - a) the hair growing on the head or b) its tonsure.
a ritual of tonsuring a male child for the first time.
a kind of horse .
a kind of plant .
open on four sides.
a seat with a square type of canopy standing on railings, open on all the four sides, for the riding on the back of an elephant; an open howdah.
to surpass others or be superior in some respect or area; do extremely well; to excel.
to make something excellently suit to or properly fit into.
to spread throughout; to fill in completely.
to become very bright, dazzling.
to become vehement, forceful, impetuous.
to act in opposition; to react unfavourably; to oppose.
one of the seven mother-goddesses.
Durge, in her formidable form, assumed to kill the demon Caṇḍa.
a kind of percussion instrument having leather membrane on one side, played with a stick.
(pl.) four sides.
(mus.) a scale of time; .
the fourth day of a lunar fortnight; the fourth day from the new moon-day or full moon day.
totalling four to thirty-four.
the cardinal number thirty-four; 34.
(pl.) four types, kinds, manners etc.
the one fourth portion of the income of a provincial government or subsidiary state that was to be given to the king or emperor.
(in gen.) any elephant.
(myth.) the Airāvata, Indra's elephant, believed to have four tusks.
= ಚೌತರಫು.
Brahma, the Creator of the Universe, who has four heads.
totalling to fourteen.
the cardinal number fourteen; 14.
the fourteenth day of a lunar fortnight; the day previous to the new moon-day or full moon day.
a kind of arrow (having four points ?).
(pl.) four directions.
(pl.) four days.
fourth day.
= ಚೌದಿಕ್ಕು.
the chief of a village.

the large-sized, deciduous tree Lagerstroemia parviflora of Lythraceae family, the hard wood of which is used in making agricultural implements, boats, and building materials; white Indian lilac tree.
in the game of dice, a score of five got four times consecutively.
a place where four roads meet or where two roads intersect each other.
to spread in (all the) four directions; to spread everywhere.
an extraordinarily courageous, strong soldier.
extraordinary courage or strength.
= ಚೌಪಟ.
(pl.) four roads running parallel to each other.
(pl.) the four states of salvation from the cycle of births and deaths, that an individual soul can attain.
a man who is spiritually eligible to attain one of the four states of salvation from the cycle of births and deaths.
a seat (as a chair, throne, etc.) having four legs.
(pros.) a meter having four feet in each stanza.
one who composes verses having four lines each.
a poem that has verses of four lines each.

totalling to fifty-four.
the cardinal number fifty-four.
= ಚೌಪಳಿಗೆ.
a big room having a square floor, esp. forming the front portion of a house.
a temporary stage, pandal constructed in a square shape.
a piece of furniture, as a chair, plank, etc. used to sit on.
a kind of medicinal plant .

a seat (as a chair, throne, etc.) having four legs.
a kind of sari (the traditional long unsewn cloth worn by women).
the large sized, evergreen tree Hardwickia pinnata of Caesalpiniaceae family, the wood of which is used for making furniture of building houses.
a complete army consisting of the four divisions - elephants, chariots, cavalry and infantry.
a building or a part of a building that has doors on four sides.
a market place at the intersection of two main roads of a town or city.
the upper storey of a building; having a roof above, but without being covered by walls.
a place where four roads meet or two roads intersect each other.

a place where four roads meet or two roads intersect each other.
(pl.) four roads running parallel.
wood suitable for making furniture, building houses, ships, etc.; timber.
something made of wood.
a large, heavy, long, dressed piece of wood used in building; a beam.
that which has or is divided into four divisions.

= ಚೌಬಾರ.
(pl.) the four corners of a building, pandal, field;, etc.
(pl.) the four faces (as of Brahma).
Brahma, the Creator of the universe, who has four faces.
the act of cutting, dressing, shaving or trimming of the hair of the head or beards.
(fig.) a losing of money (by way of unnecessary or wasteful expenditure).
a fan made of the long hair of yak (Bos grunniens).
the profession of fanning in a royal court.
the four divisions of an army - elephant-troop, troop mounted on horses, troop using chariots, and foot-soldiers.
a seat having four legs.
a royal litter or palanquin.
a plane figure with four angles and four sides; a quadrangle.
an area of one hundred square feet.
the middle-sized tree Erinocarpus nimmoanus of Tiliaceae family, with yellow flowers and fibrous bark.
totalling eighty-four.
the cardinal number eighty-four.
the entire animal kingdom (which once believed to number eighty-four lakh).
the long hair of yak (Bos gruniens).
a fan made of this.
a bunch of long hair tightly tied at one end and let loose at the other, interwoven with the hair of women while braiding.
a kind of ornament for the head used by women.
an erstwhile coin used during the reign of the provincial rulers of Citradurga, in Karnāṭaka.
an ornamental tuft used to decorate pandals, podia, platforms, etc.
(pl.) the four organs of sense, the skin, tongue, nose and eye.
a gold ornament for the head, used by women.
a gold ornament, for the head, with the tightly tied end of a bunch of long hair attached to it , used by women.
a round, almost globular, metal container with a narrow neck and a mouth, used as a water container or carrier.
a building, hut, etc. where a person normally lives; a house.
bushy moustaches.

the habit of or living made by, stealing, committing burglary regularly.
an instance of stealing, burglary, etc.; theft.
a person who habitually steals or commits burglary.
a ritual of tonsuring a male child for the first time.
an erstwhile silver coin equal to one eighth of a rupee.
the evergreen tree Gynocardia odourata of Flacourtiaceae family, the oil extracted from the seeds of which is used in curing various skin diseases.
another tree of the same family Hydnocarpus laurifolia; Tamane oil tree.
a length of four inches; (approx.) the breadth of four fingers.
a particular lock in wrestling, using four fingers.
(pl.) four ways, kinds, manners, etc.
a place where four roads meet or where two roads intersect each other.
to spread in (all the) four directions; to spread everywhere.
an extraordinarily courageous, strong soldier.

a big room having a square floor, esp. forming the front portion of a house.

a piece of furniture, as a chair, plank, etc. used to sit on.

totalling four-hundred.
the cardinal number four-hundred.
totalling to sixty-four.
the cardinal number sixty-four; 64.
the sixty-four accomplishments or arts that covers almost all spheres of human activities.

in the game of dice, a score of five got four times consecutively.

a kind of thick, red ant.
any of the kings of the erstwhile the Coromandel coast of the present Tamil Nāḍu, in southern India.
to crush or grind with the teeth; to chew; to masticate.
that which is somewhat salty.
the quality of being salty; brackishness.
sodium chloride, NaCl, a white, crystalline substance with a characteristic taste, found in natural beds, in sea water, etc.; salt.

water tasting or containing water; salty water.
water that is rich in salts as sodium chloride or potassium nitrate; salt-water.

a tract of land that is rich in salts as sodium chloride or potassium nitrate.

causing to move or go.
the act of going, moving; movement.

he who has been driven or forced out; an expelled man.

the state or quality of moving, going.
the condition or an instance of being under the surface of water.
(rhet.) a kind of composition of verses, in which replacement of a single letter would give a new meaning.
(rhet.) absence of regular or required order or succession of words in a composition, that makes the elucidation of meaning difficult or impossible, which is considered as a literary fault.
the first and tonic note, when sung with slightly lower in frequency (differing from acyutaṣaḍja which is the normal one and corresponds to the C of Western scale).
(rhet.) a literary fault of using words lacking purity, sense, etc, in a composition.
an act of slipping, sliding or falling down; a slip.
a falling down from one's position, status, etc.
a losing or being lost; an instance of this; a loss; destruction; ruin.
(gen. pronounced with the vowel 'a') the twenty-first letter of Kannaḍa alphabet and the seventh consonant.
(jumping, leaping, attacking etc.) immediately; at once.
that which is beautiful, charming, attractive.
a way of doing, being done or happening; mode of action, occurrence, etc; a manner.
enjoyment or satisfaction derived from what is to one's liking; gratification; delight; pleasure.
wish or desire; inclination of the mind.
to become attractive, beautiful or charming.
Viṣṇu, the protector of the universe.
a person or thing that protects; guardian; a protector.
a man studying the Vedic hymns.
(fig.) a man characterised by slowness, inactivity, etc.
a Vedic hymn.
a wish or desire.
a behaviour that is driven by one's freakish notion or whims; caprice.

metre - a) poetic measure; arrangement of words in regularly measured, patterned or rhythmic lines or verses; b) a particular form of such arrangement, depending on either the kind or the number of feet constituting the verse or both rhythmic kind and number of feet.
the science or study of poetic metres and versification; prosody.
the rhythmic structure in accordance with the prosody.
the regulation or regulations of prosody.
a literary composition that is according to the principles of prosody.
a violating of prosodic regulation or regulations; an instance of this, considered as a fault in the composition.
name of a non-Samskřta metre.
a variety in prosodic metres.
(pros.) the quality of a metre used, that breaks the monotony and makes the composition lively with its varieties.
(pros.) a metre that has twenty syllables in each line.

a kind of plant (= Carissa carandas of Apocynaceae family ?).

a horizontal crosspiece projecting from an inside wall of a house, at a convenient height, used as a shelf for keeping things.
the top covering of a building; a roof.
with a short, bursting sound (as a burning dry twig, a pulse being parched, roasted, etc.).

immediately; at once.

the act of going up; a climbing, soaring.

the state of two wooden pieces being joined together firmly by inserting a tenon of one piece into the mortise of another.
the act or an instance of bidding higher than others in an auction.

a year in which comparatively more (land) revenue is received by the exchequer of a state.
immediately; at once.

a thin, long piece of cloth for decorating a palanquin.
a building where shelter (sometimes food also) provided benevolently to people, esp. wayfarers.
an umbrella-like shade held for a deity or king in a procession, as a symbol of dignity.
any of various rapidly growing, fleshy fungi, typically having a stalk capped with an umbrellalike top; mushroom.

a holder of an umbrella (esp. for a king).
a king eligible for getting the royal umbrella as a sign of his kingship.
the tree Gmelina arborea (= Premna arborea) of Verbenaceae family; Cashmere Tree.
(fig.) a loss or deprivation of one's kingship.
(astrol.) a man who is born in a moment when all the planets are situated in his birth house and the houses from seventh to twelfth.
(astrol.) an instance of all the planets being in the house of birth and other six houses from seventh to twelfth, at the time of one's birth.

(Jain.) an umbrella-like thing, considered as one of the seven mythological gems, that a Jaina emperor is supposed to get, which could be used as a safe-shelter for large number of people, against sun and rain.
(palm.) an umbrella-like mark in the palm of one's hand, which is supposed to bring honour from a king and also forebode thwarting of one's enemy or enemies.
(fig.) the position, rank, dignity or dominion of a king.
the twining shrub Aristolochia indica of Aristolochiaceae family; Indian birth wort; serpent root plant.
a holder of an umbrella (esp. for a king).

a building in which people live; a residence for human beings; a house.
a house having a latticework bower intertwined with climbing vines and flowers.
a piece of cloth used for concealing something; a cloth cover.

either of the two feathered forelimbs of a bird, fully developed for flying, as in most birds or insufficiently developed for flight and used for balance in running, etc., as in chickens or ostriches or for swimming, as in penguins or some ducks; a wing.
any of the flat, thin, expanded organs, usu. green, growing laterally from the stem or twig of a plant, that is involved in the processes of photosynthesis and transpiration; a leaf.

a firm hold or control.
a resolute, determined man.

the quality of being unreasonably obstinate; obstinacy; stubbornness.
a stubborn, obstinate person.
any severe physical or mental pain; agony; anguish; torture.
haughtiness or arrogance caused by being unreasonably stubborn.

that has been cut; severed; separated (from a whole).

the part of the body enclosed by the ribs, breastbone, and diaphragm; the chest.
